markdown:
<title level="1" right="Spell 2" pfs="Standard">
[Guiding Star](/Spells.aspx?ID=923)
<actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=106" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 109 <sup>2.0</sup>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

<row gap="medium">

**Cast** [somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)

 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** planetary

**Target** 1 creature you've met
</row>

<row gap="medium">

**Duration** until your next daily preparations
</row>

</column>

---

You call on the constellations of the night sky to guide a creature to the location where you Cast the Spell. Each time the target views the stars, it receives a mental nudge toward your chosen location, though it isn't compelled to follow. The target can recognize you as the source. If the creature goes to another planet or plane, the spell's effects are suppressed, but they resume if the creature returns.
name: Guiding Star

<trait label="Detection" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=43" />
<trait label="Divination" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=47" />

</traits>

<additional-info>

**Traditions**
[Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2), [Primal](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=4)

**Target** 1 creature you've met

<row gap="medium">

</row>
</additional-info>

---

<summary>
Constellations nudge the target to travel to a location you choose.
</summary>
summary: Constellations nudge the target to travel to a location you choose.
summary_markdown: Constellations nudge the target to travel to a location you choose.
text: Guiding Star Two Actions Source Secrets of Magic pg. 109 2.0 Traditions Divine, Primal Cast somatic, verbal Range planetary Target 1 creature you've met Duration until your next daily preparations --- You call on the constellations of the night sky to guide a creature to the location where you Cast the Spell. Each time the target views the stars, it receives a mental nudge toward your chosen location, though it isn't compelled to follow. The target can recognize you as the source. If the creature goes to another planet or plane, the spell's effects are suppressed, but they resume if the creature returns.
